author: John Paul Newport
title: Summer Books: Golf
text:
Tom Coyne has a knack for setting impossible tasks for himself. In “Paper Tiger” (2006), he hit 100,000 golf shots and lost 38 pounds in an unsuccessful, yearlong quest to qualify for a professional golf tour. In “A Course Called Ireland” (2009), he played 56 coastal courses and hoisted a pint in 196 pubs in an effort to get to know his ancestral land better. Why is that so tough? Because Mr. Coyne carried his clubs and his backpack between courses, circumnavigating the entire country on foot, a distance of more than 1,000 miles.
Apparently...
